articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Hunter Schafer says passport now lists her gender as male after Trump order
articles.description: Model and actress Hunter Schafer said her new passport lists her gender as male despite selecting female while filling out paperwork.
articles.content:
Model and actress Hunter Schafer, one of the most prominent transgender women in Hollywood, said Friday that her newly issued passport lists her gender as male despite selecting female while filling out paperwork.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Sweeping Job Cuts: Trump's Federal Workforce Reduction Sparks Controversy
articles.description: President Trump's initiative to reduce the federal workforce has led to the Pentagon announcing 5,400 job cuts. Legal challenges and public backlash persist, with criticism over the impact on government services. Amid this, prominent figures like Elon Musk are playing significant roles in reshaping federal employment landscapes.
articles.content:
The Pentagon has announced plans to slash 5,400 jobs as part of President Donald Trump's directive to reduce the federal workforce. This announcement comes amid public outcry and legal challenges that have been met with mixed success in courtrooms.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Sports Betting Surge Sparks Concerns Over Addiction Rise
articles.description: Highlights include a surge in U.S. sports betting hinting at rising gambling addictions, TaylorMade's endorsement of Kai Trump, Andrey Rublev's advance to Qatar Open final, and Boone Jenner's return to NHL. Updates on MLS valuations, a Yankees policy shift, and Dodgers' Bobby Miller's recovery are also reported.
articles.content:
The surge in U.S. sports betting is raising alarms about increasing gambling addictions, the American Gaming Association revealed. A significant 23.6% rise in sports betting was reported, with Americans placing $147.9 billion in bets in 2024.

articles.title: Global Tensions and Developments: From Amazon Sinkholes to Geopolitical Shifts
articles.description: This compilation of world news covers various developments: dangerous sinkholes in Brazil's Amazon, protests in Slovakia, U.S.-Ukraine minerals deal developments, a freed Congo opposition leader, a conviction related to Salman Rushdie's attack, AP's legal action against Trump aides, a Berlin stabbing incident, and UN actions concerning Ukraine.
articles.content:
In the Brazilian Amazon, the city of Buriticupu faces a natural crisis with large sinkholes threatening to engulf homes, affecting 1,200 residents. The municipal government has declared a state of emergency as they brace for the worsening situation.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Supreme Court Delays Decision on Trump’s Attempt to Remove Watchdog Chief
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has delayed action on a request to allow former President Donald Trump to immediately dismiss Hampton Dellinger, head of the Office of Special Counsel. Appointed by President Biden, Dellinger had been temporarily protected from removal by a judge's order amidst an ongoing legal battle.
articles.content: The U.S. Supreme Court has decided to delay its decision on whether former President Donald Trump can immediately dismiss Hampton Dellinger, the leader of a federal watchdog agency. The court's action follows a judge's order temporarily blocking Trum... [855 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Supreme Court Holds the Line on Whistleblower Protector in Legal Tug-of-War
articles.description: The Supreme Court temporarily retained Hampton Dellinger, head of the Office of Special Counsel, amidst fierce legal battles surrounding the Trump administration's agenda. The decision highlights tensions between presidential powers and federal agency independence, underscored by recent efforts to overturn precedents protecting agency heads from arbitrary firings.
articles.content:
In a decisive move, the Supreme Court has temporarily held onto Hampton Dellinger, the current head of the Office of Special Counsel, as legal battles simmer over President Trump's agenda.
